# Site-Specific Plan Amendment (SSPA) Process

The county’s Site-Specific Plan Amendment Process, or SSPA for short, gives the public a way to propose a land use policy change in the Comprehensive Plan for a site or collection of parcels. This is a bi-annual, countywide cycle for reviewing site-specific proposals, called nominations, to change the Comprehensive Plan’s land use recommendations. The Comprehensive Plan is the guiding document for land use and development decisions in Fairfax County and sets forth the community’s vision for the future. With the property owner's consent, anyone can submit a proposal for site-specific land use changes.

## 2025 Countywide SSPA Process

The 2025 Countywide Site-Specific Plan Amendment nomination period is anticipated to start accepting nominations in January 2025. Nominations will be submitted via PLUS. An updated 2025 Countywide SSPA guide, overall schedule, and an instructional video of how to submit a nomination in PLUS will be available soon.
